This is because Satan was created from fire, and the human being (al-Insan) was created from clay (Salsal) like pottery (al-Fakhkhar). Then when the intimacy (Anas) with the remembrance (Dhikr) of Allah, glorified and exalted is He, is attained, he becomes cut off from other than the remembrance of Allah, and what is besides Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, is what he parts with at death, so there does not remain with him in the grave family, nor wealth, nor child, nor authority, and there does not remain except the remembrance of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic. So if he had become intimate with it, he enjoys it and delights in the removal of the obstacles that divert from it, since the necessities of needs in the worldly life (Al-Hayat Al-Dunya) divert from the remembrance of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, and after death there does not remain an obstacle, so it is as if he is left alone between him and his beloved, thus his bliss becomes great and he is freed from the prison in which he was prevented from that with which he had intimacy. And for that reason, he (the Prophet) said: 'Indeed, the Holy Spirit (Ruh Al-Qudus) inspired in my heart: Love whom you love, for you will part with him' [57]. He intended by that everything that pertains to the worldly life (Al-Dunya), for that perishes in his regard by death, so 'Everything upon it will perish (Kullu man 'alayha fanin), and there will remain the Face of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor' (Quran 55:26-27). And the worldly life (Al-Dunya) only perishes by death in his regard until it perishes in itself when the term of the Book reaches its end. And this intimacy (Anas) is what the servant (Al-'Abd) delights in after his death until he descends in the proximity of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, and ascends from the remembrance (Dhikr) to the meeting (Al-Liqa'), and that is after what is in the graves is scattered and what is in the chests is realized. And one should not deny the permanence of the remembrance (Dhikr) of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, with him after death by saying that he is annihilated, so how does the remembrance (Dhikr) of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, remain with him? For he has not been annihilated with an annihilation that prevents remembrance (Dhikr), but rather an annihilation from the worldly life (Al-Dunya) and the world of dominion and witness (Alam Al-Mulk wa Al-Shahadah), not from the world of sovereignty (Alam Al-Malakut).
